paper_abstract: Partial least squares (PLS) is a modeling technique that has met with considerable success, particularly in the fields of chemometrics and psychometrics. In this paper, we extend linear PLS to a nonlinear version called "reciprocal curves." Reciprocal curves are smooth one-dimensional curves that pass through the center of the data, are co-consistent and share several optimality properties originally identified with PLS.
